semantic_title: G89 Code Assignment Rules for Known Underlying Diagnoses
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 6. Chapter 6: Diseases of the Nervous System > b. Pain - Category G89 > 1) General coding information

content.full_text: A code from category G89 should not be assigned if the underlying (definitive) diagnosis is known, unless the reason for the encounter is pain control/management and not management of the underlying condition. When an admission or encounter is for a procedure aimed at treating the underlying condition (e.g., spinal fusion, kyphoplasty), a code for the underlying condition (e.g., vertebral fracture, spinal stenosis) should be assigned as the principal diagnosis. No code from category G89 should be assigned. (Evidence: pg no: 46, L24-L25)
content.summary: Rules for when not to assign G89 codes when underlying diagnosis is known, with exceptions for pain control encounters. (Evidence: pg no: 46, L24-L25)
